prints.title: RADIO PROGRAMS SCHEDULED FOR THE CURRENT WEEK New York
On the Air : The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio
prints.author: Dunning, John

synopses.synopsis: In 1937, Smilin' Ed McConnell was billed as NBC's 'Sunshine Melody Man,' singing hymns, accompanied by Irma Glen on piano and the Palmer Clark Orchestra. The show was produced in Chicago by NBC. (Source: 'On the Air: the Encyclopedia of Old-time Radio' by John Dunning)
